title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora evaluates Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer for third base in spring training in Fort Myers, Fla.
Caleb Durbin, recently acquired from Milwaukee Brewers, and Marcelo Mayer are practicing at 2B and 3B for the Red Sox.
Boston Red Sox prioritizes reducing errors with infield versatility, involving Romy Gonzalez, Nick Sogard, Isiah Kiner-Falefa.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Ashton Grant, Patriots QBs coach, will remain with the team, declining OC interviews with Raiders, Rams, and Seahawks.
Grant played a key role in quarterback Drake Maye's development, leading to a Super Bowl and near MVP season.
Grant's career includes working with Mike Vrabel at the Browns and starting as a quality control coach at Holy Cross.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton's Matt's Barber Shop flooded on Feb. 10 due to a burst pipe, causing significant damage to the business.
A GoFundMe campaign organized by customer Dietrich Warner raised over $25,800 to support the barbershop's recovery.
A benefit concert is set for Feb. 19 to further assist with rebuilding efforts and bring the community together.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' starring Elizabeth Olsen, Miles Teller, Callum Turner, streams on Apple TV with a romantic afterlife premise.
'Dawson's Creek', starring late James Van Der Beek, is available to stream on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.
Season 10 of 'Love Is Blind', a reality dating show on Netflix, releases in time for Valentine's Day.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A Lexington father's lawsuit excludes books on gender stereotypes after a judge ruled they aren't related to LGBTQ+ themes.
The federal judge said Alan L. cannot opt his child out of books addressing gender stereotypes like colors and activities.
Alan L.'s case against Lexington's school district hinges on preventing LGBTQ-related lessons, with the case still pending.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox outfielder Roman Anthony will join Team USA for the World Baseball Classic, replacing Corbin Carroll pending a physical.
At 21, Anthony is set to be the youngest player on Team USA, joining a talented outfield lineup for the tournament.
Anthony hit .292 with eight home runs in 71 games last season; he aims to complement the team with his left-handed batting.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The Ocean House penthouse in Westerly, Rhode Island is listed for $20 million.
The 4,696 sq. ft. penthouse offers three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and panoramic ocean views.
Ownership includes hotel amenities such as private beach access and membership to the Ocean House Club.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Celtics stand at 35-19, ranking second in the Eastern Conference before the All-Star break.
Jaylen Brown is averaging 29.3 points per game, securing his first All-Star starter selection.
Celtics face playoff concerns with a 12-14 record in clutch games, ranked 21st in the league.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter activities such as visiting museums, enjoying beaches, and exploring trails across its 15 towns.
Notable museums include the Sandwich Glass Museum, JFK Hyannis Museum, and Wydah Pirate Museum with pirate artifacts.
Winter dining options feature Bamboo Chinese Cuisine, Leonessa Italian restaurant, and Far Land Provisions deli.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Breakthrough T1D, supporting research for Type 1 Diabetes (T1D).
Lapczynski, a pharmacist from North Carolina, has managed T1D for 23 years and cares for patients with the condition.
Her motivation includes personal experiences with T1D and her mother's recent diagnosis just before her 70th birthday.
